alert.note: Alert for Musselshell; Yellowstone (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 10 at 6:23AM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 AM MDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and south central Montana, including the following counties, in central Montana, Musselshell. In south central Montana, Yellowstone. * WHEN...Until 745 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in streams and normally dry arroyos. Overflowing poor drainage areas. The Peterson burn scar area in Musselshell County will have flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 618 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms that moved over the area early this morning and produced 1 to 2 inches of rainfall. This heavy rain will cause stream flooding and excessive ponding of water on local roads. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of East Central Musselshell and Northern Yellowstone Counties, including the Peterson burn scar area in Musselshell county. - This Flood Advisory does not include the city of Billings. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Do not drive on or attempt to cross flooded roads, find an alternate route. Roads and driveways may be damaged or washed out in places. Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry arroyos is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas.
